pros: Strong community, innovative, student first, engaged workforce.
cons: Some communication gaps, especially for adjuncts.

pros: Focus on serving diverse populations, lovely scenery and outdoor opportunites, most employees try their best
cons: Low pay, disorganized, no mentorship for new employees, high turnover of employees makes it difficult to make any progress, cost of housing

pros: academic schedule, great place to live
cons: treated poorly if you don't have a PhD and aren't tenure track, even though you are teaching the same classes as everyone else. I was even asked to develop and teach senior level classes, and was still treated very badly.

pros: I'm fortunate to have a supportive supervisor, good benefits, and decent pay. I have a lot of autonomy and independence to complete my tasks. Lots of paid time off.
cons: Lots of managers, and not enough workers. Have departments really look at the problems and not just point fingers.

pros: Small college in a beautiful mountain town (Durango, CO). Is seeing enrollment growth and focuses on education for traditionally under-served people, including Native American and Alaskan Native indigenous populations. Good benefits package.
cons: Little-to-no advancement opportunity for many. Salaries are not keeping up with the cost-of-living in Durango. Low starting salaries and no system for merit increases. Some full-time staff make less than $30k, simply not a liveable wage for this area where the median home listed price is $750k (according to Realtor.com). Administration has no appreciation for work-life balance. Staff exhaustion is rampant.

pros: Working with students is incredibly rewarding.
cons: Like many others, pay was awful.

pros:
great town
great community
amazing campus
cons:
low pay
bad administration
lazy students

pros: Flexible hours that you can work whenever
cons: Sometimes dependant on others work which can constrict your hours

pros: Outstanding community and positive culture.
cons: There are no downsides that I can think of.

review_title: Great job for some extra cash
pros: Great community to work for.
cons: There are no benefits to the job.

pros: Very inclusive work environment, the faculty harbor a friendly atmosphere and are driven to serve the community and its students.
cons: Limited housing in area due to housing crisis and inflation.

review_title: Mountain view, pricey cost of living
pros: Beautiful location, kind coworkers make it a pleasant place to live and work.
cons: Salary is incredibly low compared to cost of living

pros: Community engaging culture. One on one interactions with faculty, staff and students.
cons: Lack of support for staff and faculty of color. Overload tasks without proper compensation for DEI work.

pros: Incredible good not bad at all
cons: nothing to say that is bad

pros: Beautiful location. Active and engage faculty and staff.
cons: High cost of living and mediocre salary.

pros: This school is really understanding and able to work with people with where they are at.
cons: Not as much transparency with administration.

pros: Flexible Hours and input my own time. Training for position resulted in CRLA Certificate. Experience was communication and problem solving.
cons: Created my own name tag and bought my own note pads/pencils.

pros: Community, location, supportive environment, State benefits
cons: The wages/salaries for faculty and staff will not improve without an endowment.

job_title: Director of Employer Relations in Durango, CO
pros: Wonderful campus, work environment, students and mission.
cons: Training and career advancement can be tricky.

pros: Academic focused, flexible Schedule, great community, student office
cons: Limited hours, can be tricky to learn software/technology platforms

pros: Fort Lewis is a small school that gives undergraduate students opportunities that bigger schools won't. Your professors will know you by name and build a close relationship.
cons: If you don't like a professor, you may have to deal with them for the remainder of your time there.

review_title: Amazing team  that values diversity and dedication
pros: Allows growth in role by supporting creativity innovation and work-life balance.
cons: Pay is not competitive and not living-wage

pros: Fun, engaging environment that encourages growth.
cons: Very small school with sometimes limited resources.

job_title: Financial Aid Assistant in Durango, CO
pros: Great office staff, flexible hours, adequate on-the-job training
cons: Certain times of year get extremely busy

pros: The faculty is always helpful. The maps make navigating the campus easy. B-E-A-U-TIFUL campus.
cons: The position of the campus on top of the hill limits the space of convenient parking.

job_title: Technical Services Coordinator in Durango, CO
pros: Small campus with great people.
cons: Durango is an expensive place to live.

pros: Genuine care for students and staff
cons: Smaller town to live in

review_title: Good benefits but not the best job security
pros: good benefits and great location
cons: don't value employees, tendancy to RIF as first option during budget crises

job_title: Director of Employee Relations in Durango, CO
pros: Location, community, diversity, engaged students, faculty and administration.
cons: I don't have any. We are for some people, a little remote.

pros: Works with schedules. Easy job
cons: Poor management, lack of support

pros: Leadership team is outstanding, benefits are great, and working to promote higher learning across the four corners makes my soul sing.
cons: Navigating on-campus politics can be tedious.

review_title: It's a nice place, but another good income in the family is needed or you will lose money living here on what they pay.
job_title: Technical Services Librarian in Durango, CO
pros: The people are really nice.  It's easy to get along with most everyone.  Most people really have the interest of the college and students at heart.  There is very little unpleasantness and personal interest.  Your coworkers work hard and pull their own weight and are competent to do their jobs.  The working environment is very pleasant.
cons: The resources from the state are downright pitiful.  Colorado spends less per student on public higher education than 47 other states, and they won't allow us to charge the students much tuition either, so we end up with less money per student than any other state.  What little the state does spend mostly gets spent in the Denver area, so colleges out here in the hinterlands really get short shrift.  We're the lowest of the lowly low.

pros: The students were awesome, especially the student athletes I worked with. They were not afraid to step outside their comfort zones and work hard (with the help of little to no resources)
cons:
The college itself seemed to not know what the school's identity was / what they wanted to be selling to prospective students. 
Resources (facilities, budget, supplies, etc.) were extremely minimal - which involved having to fundraise when we were out of season which was basically a 2nd full time job in order to travel & play a full schedule of games.
Salary was very low in relation to cost of living in Durango. Impossible to live on your own. And difficult to find housing if you are not already in town.

job_title: Regional Admission Counselor in Denver, CO
pros: As an Admission Counselor for FLC, you work with a great group of hard working, supportive people. There is opportunity for you to have input, and your ideas taken into consideration. You will travel a lot, work nights and weekends, however it is worth it. The benefits are great, 26 vacation days, a number of sick days, 403b, medical health and dental.
cons: The pay is lower than the state average, they recognize that but cannot seem to do anything about it. Lots of turnover.

review_title: Great place to go for school or to work as a student!
job_title: Chemistry Lab Technician in Durango, CO
pros:
• They work will your schedule, whatever it may be 
• Everyone are very helpful no matter the questions that need answering 
• The work environment is great!
cons:
• The pay can be low
• There aren't as many full time hour jobs for students 
• Not being able to get work study can be a problem for students just above the mark

review_title: Lovely place to work, but not forever
pros: Durango is a beautiful sunny place to live, FLC is a beautiful campus filled with kind, wonderful people to work with.
cons: There is not a lot of opportunity for growth and the students in general are somewhat unmotivated and can be a bit irritating.

review_title: Fort Lewis is a good place to gain professional experience after obtaining a Bachelors Degree.
pros: The people in the department are great. Departmental system allows for much learning. Many opportunities for professional development.
cons: Stagnant system. Inconsistency in supervision and communication. System can be hard to navigate and doesn't seem sustainable.

pros:
-everyone was friendly
-location of the campus was great! Overlooked the town!
-never had to park far from office
-if you need time off, it's not a hassle
-great work environment with everyone on campus, you're welcomed as soon as your arrive
-would work here again if an opportunity arose
cons: -will not get some holidays like MLK Day off, but you will get done with the school year quicker. Students out by end of April

pros: Great vacation schedule, fabulous co-workers who care deeply for the students,  beautiful campus setting on the mesa overlooking La Plata Mountains - can't beat this.  Many clubs available for students with volunteer opportunities for staff to participate and enjoy.  Good work-life balance.
cons: Low entry pay, limited advancement, status-quo  environment

pros: Great training opportunities (CRLA I and II), helpful staff faculty members, great to help students find the "ah-ha" moment
cons: The college is suffering from budget cuts, so weekly hours and pay per hour was capped.

pros: Tremendous day-to-day flexibility, supportive supervisor, great location, free housing and meals, good balance for a live-in position.
cons: slow-paced environment, not a lot of flexibility for change, experience valued over professional skills, talent and character, feels like a temporary position

review_title: Overall working at FLC can be an enriching experience
pros: Flexible schedules, enough time to work and study during shifts, great people, supportive teams
cons: Low pay rate, no environmental and sustainability awareness, no clear guidelines of duties.

review_title: Overall it was a worthwhile experience i do not regret.
pros: Great location, small school. Especially if you enjoy living in the mountains
cons: No opportunity to advance beyond the position.

review_title: leadership disregard and disdain for faculty
pros: Supportive faculty colleagues, beautiful place to live
cons: limited resources for travel and research, geographic isolation, highest level of campus leadership consistently demonstrates disdain for faculty

pros: good work enviroment. Beautiful campus.
cons: poor pay. the wages were insufficient to live in such an expensive town.

pros: Good community and the campus is located in a great place.
cons: The pay is low for almost everyone with no remedy in sight.

pros: Gain enormous lab knowledge, guidance but also given freedom with research, research advisor cares
cons: No cons to this position.

pros: flexible hours, certification, degree applicable experience
cons: none, none, none, none, none

pros: Great work environment, fun people
cons: Parking can be heinous sometimes

pros: Many good honest people work there.the campus is free of graffiti and is beautiful.
cons: The demands on the physical plant employees are unreasonable and individuals are NOT treated equally.

pros: Beautiful campus and dedicated students.
